intro: Dorstenia verdickii, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a member of the family Malvaceae. It is a perennial shrub native to tropical regions of Africa, characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires moderate to high light exposure. Dorstenia verdickii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
